job_description:
Join our HR team! Bring your high attention to detail and passion for people and processing to support key tasks in the employee lifecycle
The role
The HR Transaction Coordinator is responsible for a range of tasks associated with initiating and maintaining the employee lifecycle. As a member of the Payroll & People Systems team, the HR Coordinator uses their technical knowledge and problem solving skills to respond to queries, and action requests in line with company policies, procedures, and relevant legislation. In a role with high business exposure, the HR Coordinator is responsible for providing support to both employees and leaders, contributing to a positive and engaging employee experience
Position Accountabilities
The accountabilities of the HR Coordinator span both the HR Services and Recruitment teams:
Service Delivery:
Manage the HR email inbox, MyHR platform, Slack group chats, ensuring quick turnaround either through responsiveness, redirections, or escalations
Maintain balance of quality service and adherence to our customers in relation to the HR Contact model and Service Level Agreements
Respond to and educate (where possible) employees, leaders and other People & Culture team members with regards to queries and options for self-service, utilising relevant  email response templates
Ensure the self-service information available on our Intranet is up-to-date and helpful for employees and leaders
Provide initial or general interpretation with regards to policies, procedures or legislation
Process and administer employment records:
Efficient and high-volume transaction processing, including but not limited to new starter onboarding, employee movements, changes to conditions and flexible work requests within relevant People Systems
Maintain balance of high data quality and adherence to Service Level Agreements when processing employee documentation
Proactively work with the wider People & Culture teams and track cycle times to ensure adherence to Service Level Agreements and any relevant legislation when processing leader or employee requests
Proactively follow up with employees and leaders to ensure contracts and other HR letters are signed and saved to the employee’s profile
Other adhoc employee lifecycle processing
Data Quality and Continuous Improvement:
Identify and action opportunities for process improvement in our HR processes to increase efficiencies for a better customer experience, involving the wider People & Culture team as appropriate
Contribute to the People Services team’s agreed programs of work and overall People & Culture projects
Use data reconciliation reports to investigate errors in data between our People Systems, correct or provide a resolution to align the data
Maintain data accuracy within our People Systems by quality checking all employee data while processing leader and employee requests
Recognising problem areas, including data errors, breaches of compliance or legislation as they arise and advising the leader
What experience you’ll bring
Qualifications and Experience
General HR knowledge is highly desirable, particularly regarding the recruitment and employee lifecycles
Desirable, in progress or completed, Human Resources qualification
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent administrative skills, including high attention to detail and accuracy and strong working knowledge of Microsoft/Google Suite packages
Demonstrated experience of initiative, problem-solving solving and ability to work autonomously
Demonstrated propensity to discretion and confidentiality
Demonstrated drive and proactive approach to managing responsibilities
Ability to manage multiple streams of work and juggle competing priorities
Ability to research and learn, applying learnings to improve processes and outcomes
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a team and apply a positive attitude to resolving challenges and chasing opportunities.
Our Perks
Location:
Toowong
Close to a variety of public transport and easy parking options, the Toowong office has excellent end of trip facilities (including secure bike storage and showers), outdoor spaces and plenty of modern collaborative areas to work and connect with colleagues. Conveniently based at Toowong Village tower with views of the mountains and the Brisbane River, our location is only 4 km from the city and provides access to retail, restaurants and other amenities.
The benefits of working at A&G
Be rewarded - we recognise high performance and reward our people for their hard work through bonuses and other perks.
Access to A&G’s employee reward and recognition platform, powered by Rewards Gateway - Enjoy a wide range of benefits, including:
Personalised rewards and peer-to-peer recognition
Exclusive discounts and savings across more than 600 top retailers
A comprehensive recognition program that celebrates milestones and achievements—helping you feel valued every step of the way
Work flexibility - with options to work from home two days per week.
Options for leave - life happens, so we’ve got volunteer days, an additional paid ‘ME’ day, paid parental leave and the opportunity to purchase additional leave to cover all of the big stuff.
Grow with us - we’ve got learning and professional development opportunities to suit everyone.
Give back - our A&G Difference program gives you the power to change our community for the better through volunteering, fundraising and donation opportunities for causes that you’re passionate about.
Take care of yourself - your wellbeing is important to us and our healthy mind and body hub, mental-health support and fitness discounts will help you be your best self.
Celebrate the wins - we love sharing our successes and celebrating together - join us and you’ve got a ticket to our many on-site events throughout the year, family fun days and annual celebrations.
Save money - as well as discounts on insurance products, we’ve teamed up with some incredible retailers, hospitality providers and others to bring you discounts on your purchases, no matter where you are in Australia.
About us
Auto & General (A&G) is the fastest-growing major Motor and Home insurer in Australia, providing insurance products and solutions to safeguard a brighter future for our customers and community.
Our range of general insurance products including Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents Pet and Travel products are delivered through our multi-award-winning brand Budget Direct and partnerships with leading brands - ING, Qantas, Virgin Money and Coles Insurance.
We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.
Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.
*A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

⭐️ Ready to lead the next chapter of Contour’s growth?
To open our
first interstate campus in Brisbane, Queensland
and build a premium education experience that reshapes how students learn, and that parents rave about?
To take a proven Victorian playbook and execute it so well in Brisbane that it becomes the benchmark for our national expansion?
At Contour, we're searching for a
builder-operator
. A leader who lives and breathes high standards, loves the craft of scaling operations, and can turn a brand-new campus into a beautiful, seamless, and impactful learning space.
If the idea of planting the Contour flag in Queensland and scaling to multiple campuses lights you up, keep reading...
Starting in
2026
, Contour is expanding beyond our 8 campuses in Victoria to
Queensland, Western Australia, and South Australia
.
As Area Manager – Brisbane, you’ll be the lead operator for Brisbane. You'll open up our first campus, recruit and develop the service team, run flawless day-to-day campus operations, and set a standard that becomes indistinguishable from our best Melbourne sites.
This isn't a "maintenance mode" role. It's launch, lead, and continuously raise the bar. And your opportunity to make a tangible impact, grow as a leader, and pioneer the Queensland arm of reshaping education on a national scale.
Who We Are
At Contour, we’re reshaping education, one student at a time.
Born from the frustration of students who knew the system could be better, we set out to build what we once wished existed: tutoring that actually works. Not generic classes. Not recycled notes. Not overpriced, overcrowded rooms with an out-of-touch teacher who couldn’t relate. But a complete ecosystem of tutoring, resources, and support, meticulously designed to help every student reach their full potential.
Since 2020, over 10,000+ students have trusted Contour to guide their academic journey, and we’ve grown to over 300+ team members. We’ve produced hundreds of 99+ ATARs, tutored the World-Record UCAT scorer, and placed more students into medical school than any school in Australia.
Our growth is a testament to the simple philosophy: Put the student first, always. Everything we design, from our world-class tutor-training programs to our purpose-built campuses, exists to help students master content faster, perform with confidence, and even rekindle the joy of learning.
Contour is a group of three brands united by one goal: to give every student the best chance to achieve their full potential:
Contour Education:
Reshaping how students master their high school subjects with small-group tutoring, structured resources, and 1-on-1 support across Maths, Science, and English.
Contour Medprep:
Reshaping medical preparation with a proven, step-by-step pathway through the UCAT, interviews, and admissions, led by a team of 100+ medical students.
Contour TestPrep:
Reshaping test preparation, starting with the selective entry exam, through rigorous tutoring, mock exams, and data-driven feedback to give students a decisive advantage.
This is Contour. Built by students, for students.
What You Will Do
Launch & Expansion
Open Brisbane at 100% readiness, with immaculate facilities, team trained, and rhythms live.
Partner with Academics, People & Culture, Marketing, Tech, and the National Campus Ops team to run a plug-and-play launch that feels premium from minute one.
Operational Excellence
Own daily campus operations: class readiness, rostering, reschedules, attendance, inventory, and service operations (phone, email, text, in-person).
Audit regularly against the Campus Ops Playbook; close gaps fast; feed improvements back into the national standard.
Keep the campus beautiful: safety, compliance, maintenance, hospitality-grade presentation, and alignment with Contour's brand.
Leadership & Team Building
Hire, onboard, coach, and mentor high-calibre Service Team Members & Leaders.
Create a culture of kindness, responsibility, continuous improvement, and unity, with standards that are loving but uncompromising.
Be a trusted partner to tutors: classrooms prepped, resources perfect, tech ready. Every class, every time.
Student Experience
Own student & parent experience: walk-in conversion, NPS, referrals, event execution like mock exams.
Work with Enrolments Team to create new classes in line with demand and utilisation. Grow proactively, not reactively.
Resolve escalations with empathy and precision; protect the brand and relationships.
Continuous Improvement
Ship meaningful service improvements regularly (automation, workflow, environment, or rhythms).
Ship meaningful campus improvements across facilities, maintenance, compliance, and cost control.
Partner with founders & senior leadership to implement strategy and growth initiatives.
What You Will Bring
Minimum 3+ years of experience in multi-site or venue leadership in education, hospitality, retail, fitness. Anywhere premium service and tight ops matter.
People leader: recruits well, coaches hard and kind, builds capability and pride.
Operator’s eye: you notice the 1% details (chairs straight, print packs perfect, lighting right) and the 10,000-foot flows (schedules, staffing, cost lines).
System thinker: turns chaos into checklists, reports, rituals, and dashboards with sound project management skills.
Solution-oriented: flexible, proactive mindset with first-principles problem-solving.
Extreme ownership: proactive, accountable, allergic to “near enough.”
Mission fit: deeply aligned with reshaping education, one student at a time.
Bonus points
: education ops, franchise/rollout playbooks, new-site openings, CX/NPS programs, light technical fluency (you love automations or data).
Why You Will Love It Here
Foundational role with high impact:
Lead the QLD arm of Contour's national expansion, and directly shape student and team experiences.
Leadership growth:
We went from 1 to 8 Victorian campuses in just a few years. As we open more QLD campuses, this role can grow into State Operations Leadership.
Competitive package:
Competitive salary, benefits, EAP, birthday/loyalty leave, and the satisfaction of work that compounds and makes a real impact in students' lives.
How to Apply
If you're a builder who wants to create a premium education experience that becomes a household name in QLD, we want to meet you. Apply with your CV and a short paragraph about why you’d make an exceptional Area Manager.
Contour is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all backgrounds.

Wallace Bishop Group has been a leader in the Australian jewellery industry since 1917. As one of Australia's longest running family businesses, we have played a vital role in establishing new benchmarks in the industry and have been an essential part of our customers most important moments in life. Based in the heart of Newstead, we are looking for motivated professionals to join our team where we continue to grow with new and exciting opportunities.
An opportunity now exists for a hardworking individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment on a permanent part-time basis as a Warehouse Assistant / Van Driver.
Overview
Monday to Friday working 9.30am to 3pm, with longer hours during peak seasons.
General warehouse and distribution duties
Pick and pack retail store and online orders
Store deliveries
Detail-oriented & self-motivated needed.
Drivers licence essential

Permanent Full-time roles
Client Care Partner
Are you looking for a change and need a job that is rewarding?
St John’s Community Care is a fast-growing not-for-profit organisation that makes positive differences in the lives of the elderly and people living with disabilities in their local community. Due to the demand for our services, we have positions available and are always looking for the right people to join our organisation.
Perks and Benefits;
$34,100 tax-free: salary sacrifice benefits + compulsory tax-free threshold
Entertainment card
On call allowances
Paid Certificate III in Business or Certificate III in Individual Support
Internal movement available
Positive team-building activities
Birthday and Long service leave
Modern working environments
Ongoing support and training
Trial 9 day fortnight
Community participation in multicultural events
Rewarding working environment
Free on-site parking is available
Access to EAP
About the Organisation;
We provide community services in eight locations across the state of QLD and our mission is to assist people of all abilities and cultures to lead fulfilling lives, whilst also promoting health, well-being and re-ablement in their homes. Our organisation’s most valuable resource is our people. We foster a positive and inclusive environment with ongoing support using team-based working environments.
About the role;
The Client Care Partner is responsible for assisting in increasing independence and the quality of life for people living with disabilities and the elderly in the community. We develop custom plans to assist them in accessing programs and services. The Client Care Partner is also responsible for coordinating a group of staff, ensuring that appropriate service is provided and tasks are completed to a high standard.
Excellent phone manner and experience in customer service
Experience in Microsoft Office suite
Experience with Client and Staff Database systems
Strong ability and desire to learn and grasp concepts quickly
Proven strong analytical ability that delivers solution-based outcomes
Extremely organised, strong attention to detail and time management
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively
Can thrive and multitask in a fast-paced environment
Energetic, self-motivated and results-orientated
Have a desire and passion for helping others
Experience with My Aged Care, Home Care Packages, Commonwealth Home Support Programs and the NDIS advantageous but not necessary.
Ready to make a meaningful impact? Join us and start your journey in a rewarding, community-focused career.

As Marriott International’s
flagship brand, Marriott Hotels drives innovation in our industry. Be part of a collaborative team of creative, dynamic people setting the pace in the industry. Find your place in an environment built on strong relationships where every associate is empowered to make an impact and valued for their contributions. When you become a Marriott Hotels F&B Attendant, opportunity awaits.
Position Summary:
·        Assist with the restaurant service period, tending to the guests and exceeding their expectations
·         Deliver room service to guests in keeping with the standards of the operating procedure guidelines
·         Assist with the Club Lounge service period, tending bar and serving food to guests, fueling their curiosity and inspiring brilliance
·         Receive daily updates on hotel requests and action accordingly
·         Assist with the preparation of event & meeting spaces, tending bar and serving platters of food.
·         Engage and inspire guests throughout the complete food and beverage experience
·         Maintain outlet cleanliness and ensure all checklists are completed daily with a focus on attention to detail
·         Understand guest requirements and deliver service excellence with each customer experience
·         Collaborate with your Food and Beverage team in general operational tasks
·         Build and strengthen relationships with existing and new customers, anticipating their needs and enabling future bookings
About You:
·         An up-to-date RSA
·         Relevant experience in a similar role
·         Working rights in Australia
·         Enthusiastic to escalate your career
·         Self-motivated, driven and energized in a fast-paced environment
·         Armed with smart solutions and a can-do attitude
Our Benefits:
·         Exclusive staff discounts on food and beverage and hotel rooms (including all properties within the Marriott International group) for you, your family and friends
·         Be part of Life with the Works program where you can enjoy flexible working hours & locations, time off to pursue your passion through sabbatical leave, and paid leave during your birthday month
·         Grow, develop, and progress with internationally recognised training programs, unlimited strategic development and exciting career opportunities within the Marriott International group
·         Genuine care for associates’ physical, emotional and financial wellbeing through our Employee Assistance Program
·         Opportunity to receive Employee Referral Incentives and get paid for working with your friend
·         Work for the Largest Hotel Network in the World which values equality, diversity and inclusiveness
Marriott Hotel is part of Marriott International's Premium portfolio, which has committed to putting people first for 90+ years. Apply now!

Overview ...
At JBT Marel, what we do matters, we know that the contribution of our employees leads to the success of our business.
Our purpose is to transform the future of food; this guides our vision of being the global leader in food and beverage technology, by harnessing the full power of JBT Marel to partner with our customers and pioneer sustainable innovation.
Our values show who we are at our best. As we Create with Collaboration, Serve with Integrity, Grow with Excellence, and Advance with Innovation.
The Opportunity
The Warehouse Operator is responsible for the optimal operation of the Warehouse. The Warehouse Operator carries out work in all the logistical processes within the warehouse, such as the handling of incoming goods.
Main Tasks
·       Receives goods, checks delivery notes and other accompanying documents for goods
·       Making an active contribution to the optimal physical flow of goods, whereby quality, reliability, speed, and efficiency are the most important considerations
·       Taking part in stock audits
·       Picking goods in the warehouses and bringing the necessary goods to the right production department on time and according to planning
·       Carrying out first-line quality control and registration (for quantities and visual inspection)
·       Carrying out packing and unpacking work
·       Issuing items missing from pick orders based on missing item pick lists
·       Safe and certified  operation of industrial equipment as needed
(fork lifts
)
·       Handling the dispatch of outgoing goods and parts and service tasks
·       Participation in improvement processes (continuous improvement)
·       Putting goods in the right storage locations
·       Keeps records of claims
·       Dispatches cargo, car and container shipments
Skills and Abilities
·       Working with people; enjoys being part of a team and works well with others
·       Problem-solving; approaches difficulties with innovative insight and ability to apply technical expertise to work
·       Result-driven to and focused on meeting customer expectations and fulfilling quality standards
·       Punctuality; ability to keep to schedules, follow instructions, legal obligations and safety requirements
·       Drive to set personal work goals and objectives and the enthusiasm to achieve these
Education, Knowledge, and Experience
·       Lower secondary school education
·       At least 1 year’s relevant work experience in a warehouse environment is a plus
·       Knowledge of logistical processes and command of English is a plus
·       Knowledge of dispatch notes and other delivery documents is a plus
·       Fork lift certification or the ability to obtain such certification
·       Experience with and comfort working in multi-cultural, multi-discipline organization is an advantage
Why work at JBT  Marel
We are committed to our employees
and will provide you with development and opportunities to allow you to be the best version of yourself at work, at home, and in your community.
We foster a genuine inclusive team culture enjoying
collaborative working across our global teams to deliver world-class projects.
We encourage development
- ensuring new experiences and challenges at JBT Marel to feed your growth!
Commitment to Diversity:
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging is a fundamental value to JBT Marel and critical to our future success. A thoughtful, focused, and sustained effort to work towards our DEIB goals is not just a principled choice, but also a business imperative.
Equal Opportunity Employment:
JBT Marel provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and qualified applicants for employment. We will not tolerate any form of discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. At JBT Marel, we apply this policy to all our employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits, and training. We make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit and business needs at the time.

job_title: Virtual Specialist Secretary (100% Work from Home)
job_description:
BE PART OF SOMETHING MORE!
Start your New Year working from home!
We are growing and are seeking two experienced specialist secretaries to support our specialist clinicians across Australia.
Role 1: Surgical Specialist Secretary. You will have a minimum of 1 years' experience with frontline administration PLUS working knowledge of informed consent and theatre bookings.
Role 2: Consultant Specialist Secretary: You will have a minimum of 1 years' experience in frontline medical administration.
Our WHY:
We Care About People AND The People Who Care
ABOUT US
VMORE is a purpose driven,
leading Australian provider of virtual healthcare administration
and management services supporting specialist healthcare providers. For over 18 years VMORE has been committed to virtual support services and the flexibility this provides for providers and the VMORE team with a
quality and care focused approach.
The VMORE team consists of
digitally mature, high performing, industry professionals
who leverage off innovative technology and continue to be at the forefront of virtual care solutions. We are always on the lookout for individuals who have a passion to work at the intersection of
healthcare, technology
and
people
.
Imagine you are the patient
contacting a healthcare organisation, the
organisation has
great attention to detail, a commitment to excellence, privacy
and
communication that instils confidence
in the medical service being provided. That is what we do at VMORE.
A VMORE day is
never, ever boring
.
We believe
humour is healthy.
We focus on
flexibility, technology
and
helping people.
ABOUT YOU
You have
meticulous attention to detail
(this is critical in healthcare).
You are a
multi-tasking master.
You are
a great communicator
and
thrive when you actively engaged
and
feel valued.
You
know the importance of answering the phone
with a reassuring voice.
You
love variety
and enjoy the diversity of working across different medical disciplines.
A
positive and mature approach
with a genuine desire to assist.
Organised and focused
you are committed to providers having patient information to hand at the point of care.
You can
work autonomously
but also
cooperatively
with other team members
to achieve outcomes.
You are
comfortable using technology.
THE POSITION
This role is
100% work from home.
You will
work collaboratively with other specialist administrators
responsible for coordinating the day-to-day practice requirements for multidisciplinary healthcare providers.
Tasks you will be responsible for include:
Answering
incoming calls
and managing
patient bookings.
Processing of
clinic outpatient billing and receipting.
Accurate management of
incoming and outgoing correspondence.
Where required, timely and
accurate theatre list management
,
surgical bookings, fee estimates and preoperative arrangements.
Ensuring
quality standards
are maintained.
Managing tasks, time and
recall registers.
Providing patients with
a personalised approach.
Being an
“Ambassador”
for both VMORE and clients.
NON-NEGOTIABLE SKILLS FOR SUCCESS
Working knowledge of cloud-based software: specifically,
GENTU, XESTRO, CLINIC TO CLOUD and COREPLUS.
Working knowledge of Medicare and Health Fund terms and conditions
Working knowledge of
Office365.
Worked in
similar role for a MINIMUM of 1 years
in a medical administration role.
Committed to upholding the
Australian Privacy Principles
and
complying with our cybersecurity policies.
ROSTERED HOURS
Our hours of operation are Monday to Friday 9:00am to 5:00pm with the exception of during Daylight Saving when rostered hours are staggered across the team between 8:00am and 5:00pm
YOUR APPLICATION MUST INCLUDE:
ONLY
applicants with a
minimum of 1 years' experience
will be considered.
A
COVER LETTER
addressing the above criteria.
This part IS important to us
. A resume doesn't tell us anything about YOU or WHY you would like to work as part of the team at VMORE.
A
resume
of no more than 3 pages that is well set out and legible with at least two referees.
Upload
both
as
PDF
documents.
ABOUT OUR PROCESS:
At VMORE, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the VMORE values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants’ suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.
ONLY APPLICATIONS RECEIVED VIA SEEK WILL BE PROCESSED.

Commercial Sales Manager – Exterior Cladding Solutions
Drive Growth. Build Strong Partnerships. Lead the QLD Market.
Our client, a leading provider of exterior cladding products and façade solutions, is seeking a commercially minded Sales Manager to drive growth across Queensland.
This is a key role for a proactive, results-focused sales professional who enjoys working with trade partners, securing new business, and managing major commercial projects. You’ll take full ownership of the QLD market, managing existing accounts while expanding the client base across multi-residential, commercial, and public-sector projects.
The Role
As the Commercial Sales Manager, you will:
Achieve revenue and gross profit targets
Grow trade accounts and build long-term relationships with fabricators, installers and shopfitters
Identify and convert new business opportunities
Support partners with technical information, pricing and project assistance
Manage complex sales from initial inquiry through to delivery
Work closely with Operations and Supply Chain to ensure accurate forecasting and stock availability
Maintain up-to-date sales activity and project pipelines in the ERP system
Monitor local market trends and competitor activity
About You
You will thrive in this role if you are motivated, commercially savvy and experienced in B2B sales.
We’re looking for:
5+ years’ experience in sales
, ideally in building products or a related trade environment
Strong account management and new business development capability
Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills
Proficiency with ERP/MRP systems and Microsoft Office
A proactive, solution-focused approach and strong attention to detail
A collaborative working style with high levels of integrity
Requirements:
Year 12 completion (mandatory)
Technical/trade-related tertiary qualifications (advantageous)
Current driver’s licence and Australian work rights
Why Join This Business?
Take ownership of the QLD market
Work with high-quality, in-demand cladding products
Supportive national team and strong company values
Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
Apply Now
If you’re a driven commercial sales professional who enjoys building relationships and winning work, we’d love to hear from you.
Reference: AO #71150
If the above position appeals to you then please submit your CV to
brisbaneadmin@bespokecareers.com
and we'll be in touch. You may also wish to browse our website for other similar roles or call us to find about roles that may not be advertised. www.bespokecareers.com
Bespoke Careers is a specialist recruitment agency dedicated to connecting jobseekers with employers in architecture and design. Set up by trained architects and designers with experience in practice - we really do understand our industry and care about the people who work within it. Established for over 10 years, we recruit for high-profile practices locally and internationally and have offices in London, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, New York, Los Angeles, Dallas and Austin. Bespoke Careers is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy and is an Equal Opportunities Employer. By applying to this role you agree to our Privacy Policy.

Nautical Roofing Group Pty Ltd is a reputable company that has built its foundation on providing reliable service for years. From commercial to industrial roofing, our trade knowledge and industry experience puts you in great hands. We ensure our clients get the right advice, expertise, and the very best roofing materials.
Role Description
This full-time on-site Apprentice Roof Plumber role is located in Brisbane, QLD. As an Apprentice Roof Plumber, you will be responsible for assisting experienced roofers with a variety of tasks including installing metal roofing, and cladding for commercial buildings. As you progress in the role, you will be taught to troubleshoot and install roofing and wall cladding systems, as well as safely and efficiently use the necessary roofing tools and equipment.
Qualifications
Ability to work well in a team, show initiative, and follow directions.
Good physical fitness, time management, and communication skills.
A valid driver's license and reliable transportation to and from job sites.
Availability to work in all kinds of weather and conditions.
No formal education is required, but some prior experience in construction or plumbing is desirable.

Administrator (1 day per week)
Belloo is seeking a highly organised and proactive Administrator with bookkeeping experience to support its small team across administration, finance, grants, and governance. The role is fully remote, ideally suited to someone based in Queensland, and will operate during AEST hours.
You'll work closely with the General Manager and provide executive assistant support to the Co-Artistic Directors. It's a varied, self-directed position perfect for someone who enjoys meaningful work, thrives in a small team, and wants to contribute to one of Queensland's leading independent performing arts companies—an organisation committed to bold storytelling, deep community collaboration, First Nations-first practice, and interdisciplinary work.
You don't need a background in the arts, but you should value and enjoy supporting the sector.
What You'll Do
Each workday begins with a short online check-in with the General Manager to set priorities. From there, your tasks will vary depending on grant cycles, productions, events, payroll periods, and reporting deadlines. Responsibilities include:
Financial & Bookkeeping
Process invoices, expenses, reimbursements, allowances and petty cash
Prepare quarterly BAS and liaise with the external accountant
Manage payroll: timesheets, allowances, leave, TOIL, and pay runs
Assist with budget tracking, audits, reporting, and grant acquittals
Ensure all financial processes meet policy and compliance requirements
Administration & EA Support
Manage organisational and Co-Artistic Director calendars and meetings
Draft, issue, and track contracts for artists, creatives, suppliers, and venues
Maintain digital filing and document systems
Coordinate logistics: flights, accommodation, per diems, transport, room bookings, equipment hire, insurance and freight
Support WHS processes and assist with risk assessments and incident documentation
Grants & Development
Assist with drafting grant applications, proposals, budgets, and supporting documentation
Track all grant deadlines, reporting milestones, and acquittal requirements
Maintain organised grant files and gather required material (data, photos, statistics, financials)
Marketing & Digital
Maintain CRM and mailing lists
Assist in creating e-newsletters, EDMs, social media posts, blogs, and updates using Belloo's templates
Governance & Compliance
Assist with policy updates, version control, and the Annual Report
Assist in preparing documentation and information required for the annual audit
About You
You will be a great fit if you are:
Comfortable working in a remote environment
Highly motivated and able to independently manage workload while balancing multiple competing priorities
Must have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in administration
Must have demonstrated experience using accounting software (Xero preferred)
Comfortable undertaking a variety of administrative tasks, including some routine work such as data entry, along with scheduling, travel bookings, and contracting.
Interested in the arts sector (experience not required — enthusiasm is)
Hold valid Australian work rights
Desirable (not required):
A strong advantage if you have experience in, or an interest in:
Supporting the company’s marketing
Basic graphic design skills (Canva or Photoshop) and/or the ability to capture and edit media content
Role Details
1 day per week
(flexible scheduling)
Fully remote
— ideally QLD-based (we meet in person for dinner a couple of times a year)
Fixed-term contract
Start date:
Mid-January 2026 (flexible)
Rate:
Commensurate with experience
Please note:
Interviews will commence prior to the advertised closing date. We encourage applicants to submit their applications as soon as possible.

Working at Service Stream
Working for a ASX Listed National multi discipline company.
Positive work environment promoting internal growth, support and future opportunities.
Early entry onto new Contract commencement which will establish new ways of working.
Access to exclusive employee rewards and discounts at major retailers
About the Opportunity
Service Stream’s Utilities division are currently seeking a MECS Supervisor to join our growing company. The Supervisor will co-locate with the Urban Utilities operations team to foster a collaborative working environment and ensure seamless coordination between maintenance and operational teams. They are responsible for leading and managing allocated MECS team members to ensure the efficient and effective delivery of mechanical, electrical, and control system maintenance. This includes overseeing workforce management, interpreting timesheets, and ensuring compliance with industrial relations (IR) requirements.
Nature of position:
Permanent, Full Time
Location:
Ipswich, QLD
Reporting Line:
Area Manager
Key Responsibilities
The role also involves implementing the annual works plan within the assigned region, driving continuous improvement through risk-based and asset management approaches. The Supervisor will be responsible for managing vehicles, mobile plant and equipment resources, ensuring they are allocated effectively to meet operational demands.
A key focus of this position is prioritizing and managing responsive, corrective, and preventative work ensuring efficient resource allocation based on priority levels. The Supervisor will work closely with the Works Coordinator as the central point of contact, taking ownership of long-, medium-, and short-range maintenance programs to ensure seamless planning, execution, and delivery across networks, pumping stations, and treatment plants.
Work closely with the Works Coordinator to ensure efficient set-up of multi-level schedules for all preventive and corrective maintenance, reactive repairs, and find-and-fix tasks. This includes updating schedules and reporting progress against baseline (Total Cost of Maintenance - TCOM).
Lead the safe execution of work by ensuring that all planned maintenance activities are risk-assessed, appropriately resourced, and aligned with safety and compliance standards.
Prioritise and manage responsive, corrective, and preventative, ensuring effective coordination and alignment with priority levels
Ensure all maintenance works are delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards
Provide weekly, fortnightly, and monthly reporting on work progress, compliance, and safety metrics as required.
Plan, manage, and oversee all site operational activities necessary to meet contract requirements and ensure smooth execution of maintenance tasks.
Manage and achieve the delivery of desired specification aspects of works and services until completion and submission of all deliverables on time, within budget, and to quality standards.
Prepare and manage the list of deliverables/tasks from an overall daily works allocation standpoint.
Liaise with client stakeholders, site operations, and vendors on aspects of design and documentation work, as well as organise/manage meetings with them as required.
Ensure technical, program, quality, environmental, industrial, safety and commercial obligations are achieved and maintained on-site.
Liaise with client stakeholders, manage subcontractors and Suppliers issues and organise/manage meetings as required.
Liaise and coordinate with all external parties and relevant statutory authorities and manage their on-site attendance as necessary.
Ability to provide coverage and be available to the ECC (Emergency Control Centre) during 24/7 wet weather events when triggered by Urban Utilities.
Ability to participate in a roster for escalation, ensuring timely notification
Participate in an operational roster organisation, ensuring availability for first response and workload management, while also serving as a point of escalation and assistance during periods of high demand to support team efficiency and service continuity.
About You
Minimum 2 years’ experience in a similar role or 5 years’ experience in relatable roles
Utilities sector knowledge (mechanical and/or electrical)
Willingness to gain expertise in strategic procurement, contractor management and stakeholder engagement
Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on building positive relationships
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Willingness to upskill and undertake additional training for ongoing development
Electrical licence &/or Mechanical qualification
Formal Safety Training (desirable)
Experience with plant and equipment associated with wastewater treatment plants and pumping stations.
Sound knowledge of computer maintenance management systems
About Us
Service Stream is an equal opportunity ASX-listed business that develops and operates Australia's essential services networks across telecommunications, utilities, transport, defence, and social infrastructure industries. Specialising in designing, constructing, and maintaining new and existing networks, we provide end-to-end engineering and asset management solutions for our blue-chip client base. Committed to fostering a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion, Service Stream actively promotes the employment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with disabilities, LGBTQI individuals, and other diverse groups. As a signatory to the Veterans Employment Commitment, we also value the skills and experience of ex-ADF members and their partners, strongly considering veterans who meet the key criteria for our employment opportunities.
Service Stream does not accept any unsolicited resume referrals from external Recruitment or Labour Hire Companies.

classification: Customer Service - Call Centre (Call Centre & Customer Service)
job_description:
Overview
At JBT Marel, what we do matters, we know that the contribution of our employees leads to the success of our business.
Our purpose is to transform the future of food; this guides our vision of being the global leader in food and beverage technology, by harnessing the full power of JBT Marel to partner with our customers and pioneer sustainable innovation.
Our values show who we are at our best. As we Create with Collaboration, Serve with Integrity, Grow with Excellence, and Advance with Innovation.
The Opportunity
Customer Support Coordinator (CSC) is based out of Brisbane, Australia and serves as the key customer representative and point of contact for customer enquiries and requests. The main responsibility is to provide best in class customer service from the point of initial contact until successful fulfillment of the customer’s request. The CSC should also pro-actively work to provide and promote service solutions and spare parts to the customers. To be able to do this the CSC needs to have a good understanding of Marel’s service solutions and products.
The CSC work in close collaboration with Customer Care Manager (CCM), Spare Parts Coordinator (SPC), Service Contract Coordinator (SCC), Resource Planner, Schedulers and Technical Support to ensure an aligned approach to the customer, proactively driving customer satisfaction and sales of services and parts. This includes preparing, conveying and following up on proposals as well as preparing and following up on execution of service events.
The CSC is aligning with the customer on planning of execution of service events to secure all requirements are fulfilled and ensure together with SPC and schedulers that required Marel resources and spare parts are available. Once completed, CSC follow up with the customer to ensure they are satisfied and capture any issues or shortfalls throughout the process and feeds back to the relevant function, suggestions for improvements. The CSC also capture and push for new opportunities.
The CSC is responsible for collecting accurate information and needs of the customer to ensure successful and swift execution of the customer needs, being technical, commercial, spare parts, complaints or general enquiries. The CSC work closely with other functions in Marel to ensure customer requests are managed successfully.
The CSC role is also expected to engage strongly with customers under their responsibility by proactively communicate throughout the customer journey and identify opportunities to proactively promote service solutions, spare parts, modifications, upgrades and special offers in line with customer needs.
CSC plays a key role in keeping all customer data up to date and is responsible for updating and/or validating customer or any other information that is critical in the customer journey.
Main Tasks
Receive and process customer requests for service and spare parts
Pro-actively identify opportunities to sell service solutions, spare parts, modifications and upgrades
Close dialogue with customer to understand needs and urgency of requests
Actively promote solutions to customers
Gather information, prepare and communicate quotations for service solutions and spare parts
Follow up on outstanding quotations and processes order confirmations from customers
Register service requests and check entitlements
Answer the request when possible, and when needed direct the request to the right function in Marel, e.g. TSE or SPC
Prepare service events (resources, spare parts etc.) with SPC and Scheduler
Close dialogue with customer on planning for event to ensure all requirements are clear and fulfilled
Create and update case and work orders
Pro-actively follow up with customer if there are changes to the plan
Update customer about status and progress on his requests in a proactive manner
Follow up on executed events, including going through service reports and follow up with customer
Follow up on actions in service reports
Ensure the customer is totally satisfied by engaging strongly with him through customer journey
Escalate unresolved concerns to manager or other functions
Close dialogue with CCM, SPC, SCC and TSE to ensure aligned and pro-active approach and communication to customer, primary channel of communication to customer should be through CSC
Manage the customer expectations and customer information (data in system, case readiness)
Follow through on any shortfalls or compromised service levels
Other duties assigned due to the need of the business
Skills and Abilities
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multi-discipline team environment
A naturally outgoing individual with a profound ability to interact with customers and teams alike
Ability to build trust and lasting relationships with the customers
A customer and service minded self-starting individual, who can manage time effectively and achieve agreed goals
Ability to execute agreed tasks and deadlines against performance criteria (KPI)
Ability to build product knowledge
Computer/ERP literate
Proactive, organized and goal oriented preferred
Education, Knowledge, and Experience
General education in business administration preferred, College education preferred
Communication, customer relations or similar training preferred
Knowledge of customer service processes and preferably worked in a Sales/Service environment. Experience from Industry preferred.
At least 2 years of relevant working experience.
Experience of using an ERP, CRM or field service management systems. Appreciation of commercial service and business development
Excellent English skills, both written and verbal
Experience with and comfort working in a multi-cultural, multi-discipline organization is an advantage
Why work at JBT Marel
We are committed to our employees and will provide you with development and opportunities to allow you to be the best version of yourself at work, at home, and in your community.
We foster a genuine inclusive team culture enjoying collaborative working across our global teams to deliver world-class projects.
We encourage development - ensuring new experiences and challenges at JBT Marel to feed your growth!
Commitment To Diversity
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging is a fundamental value to JBT Marel and critical to our future success. A thoughtful, focused, and sustained effort to work towards our DEIB goals is not just a principled choice, but also a business imperative.
Equal Opportunity Employment
JBT Marel provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and qualified applicants for employment. We will not tolerate any form of discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. At JBT Marel, we apply this policy to all our employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, benefits, and training. We make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit and business needs at the time.

classification: Customer Service - Call Centre (Call Centre & Customer Service)
job_description:
About Centacare
Centacare, an agency of the Catholic Archdiocese of Brisbane, employs approximately 2,600 people across Queensland, delivering essential, high-quality services in aged care, family and community support, homelessness, and mental health.
Centacare is seeking a motivated and empathetic Customer Service Officer for a part-time position within our Enabling Services team. In this role, you will be providing high-quality customer support across multiple channels, including phone, email, and digital platforms. You will play a key role in helping clients navigate services, resolve inquiries, and ensure seamless administrative support, all while contributing to Centacare's broader mission of delivering exceptional services to our community.
Key Responsibilities:
Deliver professional, empathetic, and efficient customer service via phone, email, and in-person.
Assist clients with inquiries, service bookings, and issue resolution to ensure high satisfaction.
Maintain service standards aligned with Centacare's organisational values.
Process and maintain accurate client records and service requests.
Support administrative functions including data entry, reporting, and document preparation.
Ensure compliance with policies and procedures.
Liaise with internal teams and external stakeholders to coordinate service delivery.
Communicate service offerings and eligibility criteria clearly to clients.
Promote Centacare's programs and services to the community.
Adhere to policies, procedures, and compliance requirements, including confidentiality and data protection.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and contribute to enhancing service quality.
Assist with the Customer Experience (CX) survey process and handle inquiries.
Experience & Qualifications:
3+ years experience in customer service, contact centres, or administration.
Certificate III or higher in Business Administration, Customer Service, or related field (desirable).
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office and client management systems.
Ability to adapt to new technology and systems.
Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills.
Professional, customer-focused, and ethical work approach.
Ability to work within the ethos of the Catholic Church.
Valid driver's license, blue card, criminal history check, NDIS Worker Screening Clearance, and right to work in Australia.
What We Offer:
A values-driven workplace with a clear social impact.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development
Flexible work arrangements and a supportive team environment
A strong commitment to diversity, reconciliation, and cultural safety
Opportunity to maximise take-home pay through salary packaging benefits of up to $18,550.
How to Apply
Please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your experience and why you are the right fit for this role.
Centacare is committed to diversity and inclusion and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, and people from culturally and linguistically diverse communities. Join us in building a stronger, safer, and more connected community.
The Archdiocese of Brisbane is committed to safeguarding all children and vulnerable adults engaged in Archdiocesan activities, ministries and services, and maintains a zero-tolerance approach to any form of abuse. To support this commitment, we conduct referee checks and criminal history screening during recruitment and require employees to hold a current Queensland Working with Children Blue Card and/or undergo regular criminal history checks.

job_title: Christmas Casual with room to stay! No experience & Immediate start
job_description:
EARN SOME MONEY this Christmas so you can make sure it’s a Merry one!!!
We are looking to hire a number of self motivated individuals with retail experience that enjoy working in a team & LOVE meeting new people!!
To keep things short and sweet, these are ALL the details you’ll need to know before your interview with us in 10 points...
Cavalry & Co is a face-to-face sales and marketing agency
We work across a number of targeted marketing strategies for some of Australia's most recognised household brands (you won't be standing at a shopping centre kiosk)
Your job will be delivering positive brand impressions to the public and acquiring new customers in our sales and marketing teams (no day is the same)
Casual contract paid by the hour + BONUSES for the extra motivated
We’re aiming to give successful applicants up to 40+ hours of work each week
Opportunities for PAID TRAVEL as our clients seek NATIONAL brand recognition
In-house paid training with Mentor-to-Mentee style support
We are biased but WE ARE SOCIAL & FUN! Weekly team activities, social events and chances to make new friends
ROOM TO STAY ONBOARD
as a permanent team member PLUS chances to grow and progress into more of a leadership/management role
YES we think you should apply!!
We have BIG goals & budgets to fill over the next 2-3 months, therefore we are offering IMMEDIATE STARTS so you can hit your end of year goals!! (We are moving FAST)
Don’t wait or hesitate, APPLY!!!
Stay in the loop with us, and watch our online presence grow as we grow:
www.cavalryandco.com.au
Instagram @cavalryandco.com.au
*Successful applicants will be contacted as soon as possible

15 - 30 hours per week.
Must be able to work from 8:30PM to 4:00AM - Monday to Thursday.
2 - 4 shift per week available.
Somewhere To Stay is an international backpackers hostel hosting guests from all over the world. Our small, dedicated team pride ourselves on providing a welcoming and vibrant atmosphere for travelers.
Our team strives to ensure that each guest enjoys a memorable stay, and we are looking for NIGHT STAFF who are enthusiastic about contributing to this mission.
This job is all about people and maintaining positive vibes in a causal environment. We are seeking reliable and confident NIGHT STAFF to oversee operations across nighttime hours.
Key Responsibilities:
Guest Check-In & Relations: Welcome guests warmly, manage check-ins, handle inquiries, and address any issues or special requests.
General Cleaning Duties: Maintain cleanliness and order in common areas ensuring a pleasant environment.
Crowd Control & Noise Management: Monitor and manage noise levels and interactions among guests to foster a peaceful atmosphere.
Rule Enforcement: Confidently enforce hostel rules and policies, addressing any breaches tactfully and effectively.
Conflict Resolution: Handle conflicts or complaints with professionalism and diplomacy, ensuring positive outcomes.
Ideal Candidate:
Previous experience in a similar role or in hospitality is advantageous.
Strong conflict resolution and interpersonal skills; ability to manage and de-escalate situations.
Confident, proactive, and approachable with a keen eye for detail.
Confidence to independently work.
Must be able to work from 8:30 PM to 4:00 AM weekdays.
Why Join Us?
Be a key player in a dynamic, international environment.
Enjoy a supportive and fun team atmosphere.
Gain valuable experience in the hospitality industry.
Meet people from all over the world.
Genuinely unique work opportunity.

FUELtrac Pty Ltd is a leading independent and respected fuel price monitor. Since 1994, FUELtrac has focused on the provision of a wide range of fuel related services to organisations throughout Australia & New Zealand. As an independent organisation, we provide information and consultancy services to some of Australia's largest organisations and government agencies.
We offer our employees a working environment where job satisfaction, learning and development opportunities are a top priority.
We are currently looking for an enthusiastic person to join our committed team. This part-time role is based on a requirement of 6 hours per day, Monday – Friday.  This role would suit someone that enjoys a challenge and moving between various tasks.  The successful applicant will be responsible for daily tasks such as data loading, data audits, updating reports and ensuring files are stored appropriately.
To be successful in this position you will have:
good analytical skills
high level of attention to detail and ability to learn the business and it’s in-house software
competency with Microsoft Windows OS
medium to high skill level in the use of MS Excel & MS Office
excellent customer service skills and phone manner
ability to work without supervision and be self motivated as WFH option is available
effective time management and high level work ethic & reliability
strong verbal communication skills
A competitive salary, dependent on skills & experience, will be offered to the right candidate. This casual position is for 30 hours per week to be covered Mon – Fri each week.  Availability to start immediately is critical.

About the role
Synergy Service Group is seeking experienced Fence Installers for full-time sub-contractor roles in Brisbane, QLD(include Ipswich, Logan, and surrounding area). As a Fence Installer, you will be responsible for the efficient and high-quality installation of fences and gates to deliver outstanding results for our clients. This is a hands-on role that requires attention to detail and a commitment to safety.
What you'll be doing
Install and repair a variety of fencing types including timber, colorbond, pool and security fences.
Demolition of existing structure
Measure, mark and prepare installation sites according to specifications
Dig holes, set posts and attach panels, rails and gates to complete the fence installation
Ensure all work is completed to a high standard and meets all safety and quality requirements
Communicate effectively with clients and team members to address any issues or queries(great positive communication skill is crucial!)
Maintain tools and equipment in good working order
Adhere to all site safety procedures and wear appropriate personal protective equipment
What we're looking for
Previous experience as a Fence Installer or in a similar construction/trade role
Positive Can-do attitude to conquer problems
Strong practical skills and the ability to read and interpret fence installation plans
Good manual dexterity and physical fitness to handle the physical demands of the role
Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality workmanship(Priority skill)
Excellent communication and customer service skills(Priority skill)
A current driver's licence and your own reliable vehicle with relevant tools
Knowledge of relevant safety standards and the ability to work safely on job sites
What we offer
As a leading provider of fencing and landscaping services, Synergy Service Group offers competitive rates based on per meter rate plus flexible adjustment according to the complexity of the project(Fixed day rate option is available too). Ongoing training and development, and the opportunity to build a rewarding career. You'll be part of a friendly, collaborative team and have the support you need to succeed.
About us
Synergy Service Group is a trusted provider of quality fencing and landscaping solutions in Brisbane and the surrounding region. Our commitment to excellence, safety and customer satisfaction has made us a preferred partner for both commercial and residential clients. Join our team and be a part of our continued growth and success.
Apply now to become our next Fence Installer!

classification: Records Management & Document Control (Administration & Office Support)
job_description:
About QLeave
QLeave is a statutory body administering portable long service leave schemes for workers in the building and construction, contract cleaning and community services industries. We manage more than $2 billion in funds under investment and play a crucial role in ensuring workers receive the long service leave they've earned.
We are a values-driven organisation committed to strong governance, accountability and service excellence. We uphold and promote the
Human Rights Act 2019
through our decisions, culture and workforce practices.
The Opportunity
As our Records Management Coordinator, you will be a key contributor to the performance and reliability of our electronic Document and Records Management System (eDRMS – HPE Content Manager). Your work will directly support QLeave's ability to meet legal, regulatory and organisational recordkeeping obligations.
In this role, you'll be trusted with responsibility, encouraged to contribute ideas, and supported to develop your professional expertise. You will work closely with business areas to build capability, improve user experience, streamline processes and strengthen compliance.
This position reports to the Principal Records Management Officer.
What you'll do
You will bring strong technical capability, curiosity and initiative to:
perform eDRMS (Content Manager) system administration including metadata clean-up, folder creation/closure, archiving, disposal and user access management.
monitor data quality and implement processes that strengthen system integrity and consistency.
ensure organisational compliance with the
Public Records Act 2023
, Records Governance Policy, Queensland State Archives requirements, and QLeave policies.
conduct audits, identify trends and emerging risks, and advise leaders on improvement opportunities.
provide clear, timely and practical advice to staff across all levels.
deliver recordkeeping and eDRMS training tailored to user needs and system changes.
build positive engagement through proactive education and responding to user requests.
review and update procedures, work instructions and user guides.
recommend enhancements that improve system usability, efficiency and data quality.
contribute to organisational initiatives that strengthen information governance and a positive recordkeeping culture.
What We're Looking For
We're seeking someone who brings both technical capability and a proactive, solutions-focused mindset.
You will be successful in this role if you have:
demonstrated experience using HPE Content Manager (or a comparable eDRMS), including system administration tools and functions.
strong understanding of information and records management legislation, standards and best practice.
excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts in a user-friendly way.
ability to work with accuracy and attention to detail, while balancing competing priorities.
collaborative approach, with the confidence to influence and guide others.
commitment to continuous improvement, ethical behaviour and QLeave's values.
There are
no mandatory qualifications
, but practical experience in records or information management will be highly regarded.
Conditions and Benefits
Convenient Northgate location with free on-site and street parking.
Competitive salary with up to 12.75% superannuation contributions.
Generous leave entitlements, including annual leave loading.
Flexible work arrangements and a commitment to employee well-being.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
How to Apply
QLeave appointments are based on selecting the eligible applicant best suited to the position.  We will assess your application based on your experience, potential for development, and your personal qualities.
To be considered for this role, your application
must
include:
A detailed resume outlining your qualifications, experience, and achievements.
A brief letter (1-2 pages) explaining your motivation for the role and how your skills align with the requirements.
For further information or a confidential discussion, please contact Maureen Buckland.
Applications close 2 January 2026
QLeave values diversity and is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. Adjustments to the recruitment process are available upon request to ensure all candidates can showcase their abilities.

job_title: Bar staff / Wait Staff / Host / Door staff Wanted
job_description:
About the business
Honey B’s is one of Brisbane’s trendiest and leading gentlemen’s clubs located on Caxton St, just minutes away from Suncorp Stadium. We are a brand-new venue with premium bars, high standards of service, and a fun and unique fit-out. Game nights are huge at Honey B’s and we are looking for friendly and outgoing staff to join our sport-loving team!
About the role
We are open 7 nights a week and are getting busier! If you are motivated, enthusiastic and take pride in delivering 5-star service, then we want you! Duties include:
Providing excellent customer service
Liaising with clients professionally and with a warm, friendly demeanour
All bar duties as required, as well as beverage and bottle service
Being enthusiastic, reliable and self-driven
In return, you will be rewarded for working with an industry-leading organisation that offers:
Uncapped earning potential, driven by YOU!
Flexible hours with opportunities to earn extra $$$
Full training in the hospitality role
A safe, fun and friendly team environment
Award public holiday rates also apply
The ideal applicant must be available to work Fridays and on weekends. Experience in the hospitality industry is preferred but not essential as full job training is provided. All applicants must be over 18 years old.
Visit our website for more job opportunities!
How to apply?
Apply directly via our website. Successful candidates will be invited to an interview.

Join our HR team! Bring your high attention to detail and passion for people and processing to support key tasks in the employee lifecycle
The role
The HR Transaction Coordinator is responsible for a range of tasks associated with initiating and maintaining the employee lifecycle. As a member of the Payroll & People Systems team, the HR Coordinator uses their technical knowledge and problem solving skills to respond to queries, and action requests in line with company policies, procedures, and relevant legislation. In a role with high business exposure, the HR Coordinator is responsible for providing support to both employees and leaders, contributing to a positive and engaging employee experience
Position Accountabilities
The accountabilities of the HR Coordinator span both the HR Services and Recruitment teams:
Service Delivery:
Manage the HR email inbox, MyHR platform, Slack group chats, ensuring quick turnaround either through responsiveness, redirections, or escalations
Maintain balance of quality service and adherence to our customers in relation to the HR Contact model and Service Level Agreements
Respond to and educate (where possible) employees, leaders and other People & Culture team members with regards to queries and options for self-service, utilising relevant  email response templates
Ensure the self-service information available on our Intranet is up-to-date and helpful for employees and leaders
Provide initial or general interpretation with regards to policies, procedures or legislation
Process and administer employment records:
Efficient and high-volume transaction processing, including but not limited to new starter onboarding, employee movements, changes to conditions and flexible work requests within relevant People Systems
Maintain balance of high data quality and adherence to Service Level Agreements when processing employee documentation
Proactively work with the wider People & Culture teams and track cycle times to ensure adherence to Service Level Agreements and any relevant legislation when processing leader or employee requests
Proactively follow up with employees and leaders to ensure contracts and other HR letters are signed and saved to the employee’s profile
Other adhoc employee lifecycle processing
Data Quality and Continuous Improvement:
Identify and action opportunities for process improvement in our HR processes to increase efficiencies for a better customer experience, involving the wider People & Culture team as appropriate
Contribute to the People Services team’s agreed programs of work and overall People & Culture projects
Use data reconciliation reports to investigate errors in data between our People Systems, correct or provide a resolution to align the data
Maintain data accuracy within our People Systems by quality checking all employee data while processing leader and employee requests
Recognising problem areas, including data errors, breaches of compliance or legislation as they arise and advising the leader
What experience you’ll bring
Qualifications and Experience
General HR knowledge is highly desirable, particularly regarding the recruitment and employee lifecycles
Desirable, in progress or completed, Human Resources qualification
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent administrative skills, including high attention to detail and accuracy and strong working knowledge of Microsoft/Google Suite packages
Demonstrated experience of initiative, problem-solving solving and ability to work autonomously
Demonstrated propensity to discretion and confidentiality
Demonstrated drive and proactive approach to managing responsibilities
Ability to manage multiple streams of work and juggle competing priorities
Ability to research and learn, applying learnings to improve processes and outcomes
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a team and apply a positive attitude to resolving challenges and chasing opportunities.
Our Perks
Location:
Toowong
Close to a variety of public transport and easy parking options, the Toowong office has excellent end of trip facilities (including secure bike storage and showers), outdoor spaces and plenty of modern collaborative areas to work and connect with colleagues. Conveniently based at Toowong Village tower with views of the mountains and the Brisbane River, our location is only 4 km from the city and provides access to retail, restaurants and other amenities.
The benefits of working at A&G
Be rewarded - we recognise high performance and reward our people for their hard work through bonuses and other perks.
Access to A&G’s employee reward and recognition platform, powered by Rewards Gateway - Enjoy a wide range of benefits, including:
Personalised rewards and peer-to-peer recognition
Exclusive discounts and savings across more than 600 top retailers
A comprehensive recognition program that celebrates milestones and achievements—helping you feel valued every step of the way
Work flexibility - with options to work from home two days per week.
Options for leave - life happens, so we’ve got volunteer days, an additional paid ‘ME’ day, paid parental leave and the opportunity to purchase additional leave to cover all of the big stuff.
Grow with us - we’ve got learning and professional development opportunities to suit everyone.
Give back - our A&G Difference program gives you the power to change our community for the better through volunteering, fundraising and donation opportunities for causes that you’re passionate about.
Take care of yourself - your wellbeing is important to us and our healthy mind and body hub, mental-health support and fitness discounts will help you be your best self.
Celebrate the wins - we love sharing our successes and celebrating together - join us and you’ve got a ticket to our many on-site events throughout the year, family fun days and annual celebrations.
Save money - as well as discounts on insurance products, we’ve teamed up with some incredible retailers, hospitality providers and others to bring you discounts on your purchases, no matter where you are in Australia.
About us
Auto & General (A&G) is the fastest-growing major Motor and Home insurer in Australia, providing insurance products and solutions to safeguard a brighter future for our customers and community.
Our range of general insurance products including Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents Pet and Travel products are delivered through our multi-award-winning brand Budget Direct and partnerships with leading brands - ING, Qantas, Virgin Money and Coles Insurance.
We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.
Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.
*A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_title: B2B Sales: Work from Home and Drive Massive Growth for Trades Businesses
job_description:
Are you ambitious, eager to learn, and ready to build a rewarding career in sales? At
Electrician Accelerator, Plumber Accelerator, and All Trades Accelerator
, we provide the tools, training, and mentorship you need to succeed—even if you have
no prior experience.
This is your opportunity to join a team helping tradie business owners take their businesses to the next level with proven coaching and mentoring program.
Why You’ll Love This Role
No Experience Needed:
We’ll train you in our proven sales processes, step by step. Just follow the process.
Unlimited Earnings:
Your success is in your hands, with uncapped commission potential.
Remote Work:
Work from home or anywhere that suits you, with no daily commute.
Meaningful Impact:
Help transform the lives of trades business owners by connecting them with the tools they need to succeed.
Growth & Development:
Learn directly from industry leaders and develop your sales skills that can set you up for life.
What We’re Looking For
Ambition:
You’re hungry to succeed and ready to commit 100% to your personal and professional growth.
Coachability:
You’re open to feedback and willing to follow a proven sales process to achieve success.
Work Ethic:
You’re prepared to put in the time and effort required to hit and exceed targets.
Resilience:
You can handle rejection and keep pushing forward with determination.
People Skills:
You love connecting with others and helping them solve their challenges.
What You’ll Do
Learn and Apply:
Master our step-by-step sales training to confidently navigate sales conversations.
Connect with Prospects:
Make outbound calls, follow up with leads, and book strategy sessions.
Deliver Value:
Conduct sales calls that uncover client needs and align them with our coaching program.
Track Your Progress:
Use CRM tools to manage leads, track metrics, and improve your performance over time.
Grow Quickly:
Apply feedback from our team to consistently improve and reach higher earning levels.
What Success Looks Like
You’re booking multiple strategy sessions with potential clients each week.
You’re closing deals consistently, earning more than $25,000 p/m in commissions.
You’re growing in confidence, skills, and income month by month.
Who This Role Is For
✅ You’re ready to dedicate yourself fully to learning and earning.
✅ You want to work hard and achieve financial freedom.
✅ You’re excited about helping others succeed while building a successful sales career.
✅ You thrive in an environment where your effort directly impacts your income.
Who This Role Isn’t For
❌ You’re not willing to put in the hard work required to succeed.
❌ Seeking safe and secure salary. This is a commission only role
❌ You’re looking for a casual, low-effort job with minimal accountability.
❌ You’re not open to learning or following a proven system.
What We Provide
Comprehensive sales training—no experience required but if you have experience even better.
Access to world-class sales training from our founder.
A supportive team committed to helping you grow.
Ready to Get Started?
If you’re ready to build a career in sales and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!
To Apply:
Go here and apply.  https://go.electricianaccelerator.com/hiring
